chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm
Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond H Koester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:22 A.M., Attorney David Karpe appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Karpe states defendant will be present, running late, Court goes over Motions in Limine in 17 CF 251, Court grants #1, Court grants #2A, #2B, #2C, #2D, parties will stipulate defendant was on bond, #3, Court grants, #4, Court grants, #5, Court grants, #6, Court grants, #7, State won't use as state in chief but may use for rebuttel, #8, Court will take under advisement if arises, #9, Court grants, #10, Court grants, #11, Court grants, #12, Court grants, #13, Court grants, #14, State objects, Court will not order, 18 CF 80 to be set for jury trial w/Br. 2, 15 CF 232 to remain as scheduled, Atty Long addresses defendant's address, 10:44 A.M., Defendant appears, explanation given, 10:46 A.M.

Final pre-trial on November 5, 2018 at 10:00 am.

10:02 Defendant Raymond H Koester in court with attorney David Karpe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 17CF251 & 15CF232. Counsel has checked with witnesses and everyone is available for the trial dates currently set.  Court proceeded with the suppression motion. Deputy Weber sworn, took stand. Cross examination. Atty Karpe filed a transcript of the video with Judge. Stated audio is available for the Court to review. Referenced page 7 of transcript. State's position to Court is stipulated there was no probable cause at time of arrest for bail jumping, but there was probable cause for the arrest. Transcript marked as exhibit #1. Received by Court. Redirect. Recross. Witness excused. Counsel is to file briefs. Court will review transcript. Simultaneous briefs to be filed by 8/22/18, with the response due on 9/5/18. Oral ruling will be on 10/12/18 unless Court gives a written decision. In regards to the motion to reopen the standing issue, State opposed with argument. Atty Karpe argued. Rebuttel. Court reviewed the motion filed found it does not sufficiently establish grounds. Motion denied. Bond issue: argument heard. State objected to just any adult supervising the contact, requested no contact with the child. Court will modified the bond if counsel can find a nuetural 3rd party other than HHS, to supervise contact with GLK. Upon agreement by counsel it is to be sent to court as a stipulation/order. 10:56
Jury trial on February 11, 2019 at 08:30 am.

#2 Curriculum Vitae of Dr. Lawrence T White.

Defendant Raymond H Koester in court with attorney David Karpe.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion in Limine on statement taken from defendant.  Court wants to explore custody status of defendant.  Argument by counsel.  Atty Karpe agrees non custodial status.   2:07/2:17 Recess to allow counsel to review Hoppe ruling. /2:28pm Court resumes.  Atty Karpe argues Quigley ruling.  Court finds once defendant states he wants attorney, no statements after that are allowed at trial.  Transcript of UW interview marked as Exhibit #1.  Dr Larry White called, sworn and takes stand.  Direct by Atty Karpe.  Exhibit #2 Curriculum Vitae and  testimony as to experience and education.  Dr White gave testimony.  3:09 pm Cross exam by ADA Burdon.  3:13 pm Direct by Atty Karpe.  Witness excused.  3:21pm Detective Sgt Corey Miller called, sworn and takes stand.  Direct by ADA Burdon.  Defendant identified.  Stipulated.  3:30 Cross exam by Atty Karpe.  3:44 pm Witness excused.  Recess.  3:53 Court resumes.  Exhibit #1 Transcript .  #2 Curillcum Vitae of Dr White.  #3 CD of Transcript in Exhibit 1.   Court found totality of circumstances statement by defendant with restrictions stated earlier was voluntary and motion to suppress is denied.  Statement made by defendant is allowed and full cross exam allowed.  Other Motion in Limine filed by State  will not be addressed list.  Atty Karpe questions if Barbara Knox will be on witness list. .  Atty Karpe does not have discovery for that witness.  Court finds she is not a surprise witness to defense.  State has given all discovery to Atty Karpe.  State has until 4pm on 7-28-17 to email discovery to Atty Karpe.  4:16 Recess.
Curriculum Vitae of Dr. Larry White, goes with Summary filed by atty Karpe

Defendant Raymond H Koester in court, in custody with attorney David Karpe.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond to lower cash.  State opposed request to modify the bond.  Argument given by Atty Karpe.  Court added conditions of bond to include: no unsupervised contact with any minor children under 17.  $10,000.00 cash bond.  If defendant can post the bond he is to report to the VA hospital within 48 hours.  No contact with victim remains.
